availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Harvey Barbour (Pendleton County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, physician. New Richmond, Ohio, native. Son of Nathaniel Barbour and Hanna Ashburn Barbour. Married to Emmeline Hauser Barbour in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on October 27, 1852. Father of Mary Barbour, Ashburn K. Barbour, and Henry T. Barbour. Physician in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 2.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Marriages.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016147, Pendleton County Deaths, File #23388.
Find A Grave, "Dr James Hervey 'Hervey' Barbour (1824-1912)," Memorial #78323783, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78323783 (accessed June 7, 2018).
